page.title: 14Transport - Aby area
page.content: Main transport is by privately owned car, lorry or motor cycle. Most households own one or more private cars or cycles. Delivery of bread, milk, meat, fish, vegetables & papers is usually by privately owned vans. Coal, bottle gas, beer & heavier goods by lorry or heavier transport. There is a twice weekly bus service though from Alford to Louth, latterly the use of the School Bus has been open to the public but little used. A weekly delivery of parcels by British Road services brings in larger parcels. There are no services, petrol, etc., - people travel out to find these. There is a voluntary car service run to enable people with no transport to visit health centres.
